New Records: The White Sox were on the brink of setting a new record for the most losses in modern baseball history, aiming to avoid matching or surpassing the New York Mets' 120 losses in 1962.
Key Match Events: The White Sox scored three runs in the bottom of the eighth inning to rally from a 2-0 deficit and secure a 3-2 victory over the Los Angeles Angels, avoiding a potential record-breaking loss.
Pre-Game Insights: The game was crucial for the White Sox to avoid a 121st loss, which would have surpassed the New York Mets' 120 losses in 1962, a significant historical context for the team.
Post-Match Reflections: The White Sox avoided the record loss, with fans and the team showing relief and resilience after the dramatic comeback victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game saw fans eager to witness history, with the White Sox ultimately delivering a victory that prevented a major milestone in team history.
